data.enText: a short surprise attack on an enemy by soldiers, ships or aircraft

data.chText: 他们突然出击，轰炸了敌军的基地。
data.enText: They carried out a bombing raid on enemy bases.
a surprise visit by the police looking for criminals or for illegal goods or drugs

data.chText: 在一次清晨的突击搜查中，他们都被捕了。
data.enText: They were arrested during a dawn raid .
an attack on a building, etc. in order to commit a crime
to visit a person or place without warning to look for criminals, illegal goods, drugs, etc.
to attack a place without warning

data.chText: 边境附近的村庄经常遭受突袭。
data.enText: Villages along the border are regularly raided.
a raiding party (= a group of soldiers, etc. that attack a place)
to enter a place, usually using force, and steal from it

data.chText: 上世纪这些坟墓遭到偷盗，很多财宝都失踪了。
data.enText: Many treasures were lost when the tombs were raided in the last century.

data.chText: 我撞见他又在扫荡冰箱里的食物。
data.enText: I caught him raiding the fridge again (= taking food from it) .

tr: an attempt by speculators to defraud investors
search for something needed or desired
enter someone else's territory and take spoils
example: The pirates raided the coastal villages regularly

tr: take over (a company) by buying a controlling interest of its stock
example: T. Boone Pickens raided many large companies

tr: search without warning, make a sudden surprise attack on
example: The police raided the crack house

value.def: When soldiers raid a place, they make a sudden armed attack against it, with the aim of causing damage rather than occupying any of the enemy's land.

example.ex: The guerrillas raided banks and destroyed a police barracks and an electricity substation.
example.tran: 游击队突袭了银行，摧毁了一处警察驻地和一个变电站。

example.ex: The rebels attempted a surprise raid on a military camp...
example.tran: 叛军试图突袭一处军营。

example.ex: Its planes are carrying out heavy bombing raids against the guerrillas.
example.tran: 其飞机正在对游击队实施密集轰炸。

value.def: If the police raid a building, they enter it suddenly and by force in order to look for dangerous criminals or for evidence of something illegal, such as drugs or weapons.

example.ex: Fraud squad officers raided the firm's offices.
example.tran: 反欺诈小组的工作人员突击搜查了这家公司的办公室。

example.ex: They were arrested early this morning after a raid on a house by thirty armed police.
example.tran: 今天早上30名武装警察突击搜查一所房子后将他们逮捕。

value.def: If someone raids a building or place, they enter it by force in order to steal something.

example.ex: A 19-year-old man has been found guilty of raiding a bank.
example.tran: 一个19岁的男子被判抢劫银行罪。

example.ex: ...an armed raid on a small Post Office...
example.tran: 对一家小邮局实施的武装抢劫

example.ex: He carried out a series of bank raids.
example.tran: 他实施了一系列的银行抢劫。

value.def: If you raid the fridge or the larder, you take food from it to eat instead of a meal or in between meals.

example.ex: She made her way to the kitchen to raid the fridge.
example.tran: 她走向厨房去扫荡冰箱。

value.tran: 扫荡（冰箱、食品柜等处）的食物
